intro: Schmidelia rigida, commonly known as the rigid schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early spring. Schmidelia rigida is adapted to dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Apiaceae family.
